newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi stocks volume triples in year - SAMA.
newsitem.headline: Saudi stocks volume triples in year - SAMA.

text.p: The volume and value of shares traded on the Saudi stock exchange increased by 315 and 266 percent respectively in the first quarter of 1997 compared with a year earlier, the Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency (SAMA) said on Tuesday.

Some 83.3 million shares worth 12.1 billion riyals were traded, compared with 20 million shares valued at 3.3 billion during the first quarter of 1996, the kingdom's central bank said in its quarterly market review.
The services sector was the most actively traded with 40 million shares changing hands -- some 48 percent of market activity, SAMA said.
The banking sector ranked ahead of others in terms of value which totalled 3.8 billion riyals or 31 percent of total volume traded.

Riyadh Construction Company led the market in terms of individual stocks with 9.1 million shares changing hands, followed by Riyadh Bank with 6.8 million shares and Saudi Auto Services Company with 6.7 million shares traded.

Riyadh Bank led the market in individual movements, recording 1.8 billion riyals worth of shares traded, followed by SABIC and Saudi Cement Company, with 1.0 billion and 973 million riyals respectively.
Market capitalisation was 187.7 billion ($50 billion) at the end of March compared with 147.2 billion ($39 billion) a year earlier -- an increase of 28 percent.
The all-share index ended the quarter at 165 points, 26 percent higher than the 131 at the end of March 1996.

There were no new issues in the primary market during the first quarter. But Arab National Bank raised its share capital to 1.5 billion riyals from 1.2 billion through a bonus shares issue on a one-for-four basis.
The Cement Company (South) raised its capital to 1.05 billion riyals from 700 million through a one-for-two bonus shares issue.
Saudi Ceramic Company announced it would raise its share capital to 200 million riyals from 150 million through a one-for-three bonus share issue.
Saudi Cable Company also announced it would raise its share capital to 500 million riyals from 300 million in two stages through rights and bonus issues.
